    Prerequisite(s): ECON 325 and a confirmed internship approved by the Shuford Program's Career Development Manager.

    Enrollment in ECON 193 is restricted to declared Entrepreneurship Minor students who have confirmed an approved internship with the Shuford Program¿s Career
    Development Manager. Students who do not meet this criteria will be automatically dropped from the course.

    Students who meet this criteria will be manually enrolled in ECON 193 by the Shuford Program Coordinator by the first day of classes - students may not
    register for this course directly.

    If you have any questions, please email the Shuford Program Coordinator, Molly Matthews at mjmatthews@unc.edu.

      Class Enrl Cap:2               Class Enrl Tot:0               Class Wait Cap:0              Class Wait Tot:0               Class Min Enrl:0

                                                                                                                                                              GR3

    MTSC891, section 001 is a one-credit internship course.

    Course Description:
    Students will engage in a mentored intership experience at a non-academic technology-based organization, such as a company or government laboratory.  The
    experience will be supervised by a mentor at the company and monitored by the instructor of record.

    Course Objectives:

    - Students will gain an understanding of the working environment of a non-academic technology-based organization;
    - Students will develop technical and interpersonal skills required in a technology-based working environment;

                                                                                                                                                             GR1

    Course Description:

    Engage with the history of the Penn Center at Wilson Library, before travelling to St. Helena Island, South Carolina to aid the Penn Center and local
    communities in preserving Gullah and Geechee heritage through newly discovered archival materials.
    Learn how memory can be activated in the service of historically Black spaces and places.

                              College of Arts & Sciences - Exercise and Sports Science - Subject: EXERCISE AND SPORT SCIENCE


____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________SubjectCatalog NbrSectionClass NbrCourse TitleComponentUnitsTopics
  EXSS      290        001      2116        SPECIAL TOPICS IN EXSS       Lecture                      3                                        X
                                                                                            (Remote Only - All Asynchronous)
      Bldg: TBA                      Room: TBA            Days: TBA            Time: TBA             EXSS General Field E
                                                                                                                      INST            100     Instructor:Pratt,Angela Noelle

      Class Enrl Cap:30               Class Enrl Tot:0               Class Wait Cap:0               Class Wait Tot:0               Class Min Enrl:0

                                                                                                                                                              GR1
      Class Equivalents:EXSS 290/290H

    The purpose of this course is to provide the student with a structured, supervised practical experience in exercise and sport science professional settings.
    Students will be individually mentored by on-site supervisors who will be responsible for assigning and assessing meaningful work, as well as providing
    training, feedback, and opportunities for participation in organizational activities (i.e., meetings, events). Students will also receive guidance for
    professional development from their lead instructor in the form of in-class activities, focused assignments, and guest speakers.
    This course is for Junior or Senior EXSS GENERAL Majors only (not SA or FP) with a GPA of 2.0 or above.
    EXSS General Field Experience
